Abstract: This autobiography chronicles the author’s journey as a strategic scientist, weaving together personal experiences and professional milestones. Born and educated in China, the author’s early fascination with the cosmos led to a career at the forefront of radio astronomy and astro-geodynamics. The narrative explores the pivotal role of Very Long Baseline Interferometry (VLBI) in advancing our understanding of Earth’s dynamics and the precision of deep space exploration. The author highlights significant contributions to international scientific collaborations, emphasizing the importance of global partnerships in addressing complex challenges in space science. Through a blend of personal anecdotes and scientific insights, the book offers a unique perspective on the evolution of radio astronomy and the interdisciplinary nature of modern astro-geodynamics. It also reflects on the author’s experiences navigating the scientific landscape in China and the broader international community, underscoring the impact of cultural and institutional contexts on scientific progress.
